The text pertains to the dissolution of the Medical Council of India, vacating offices of appointed persons, and compensation for premature termination.
The Chairman and other Members shall vacate their respective offices upon dissolution of the Medical Council of India.
The Chairman and other Members are entitled to claim compensation not exceeding three months' pay and allowances for the premature termination of their office or contract.
Any officer or other employee appointed on deputation basis to the Medical Council of India shall, on dissolution, stand reverted to his parent cadre, Ministry or Department.

Any officer or other employee employed on regular or contractual basis by the Medical Council of India shall cease to be an officer or employee upon dissolution and their employment terminated with immediate effect.
An officer or employee of the Medical Council of India is entitled to compensation for premature termination of employment, not less than three months' pay and allowances.
